title: Sales Manager
Sales Manager
Sales Manager
Sales Manager
People Operations Lead
description:
About the Role

This is a hands-on, high-ownership role for someone who can design and run core people systems while building the scaffolding for scale. You’ll own end-to-end employee lifecycle processes, lead our compliance infrastructure, and implement the systems that help us move faster without dropping the ball.

You’ll be the go-to person for employee questions and People Ops initiatives, and you’ll be empowered to fix what’s broken, improve what exists, and introduce what’s missing.

This role does not manage people, but it has outsized influence across the company.

About the Team

We’re a lean, high-impact team spanning two continents. Today, the team includes recruiters, an HRBP, and an HR generalist. We’re looking for a People Ops lead who thrives in ambiguity, moves fast, and wants to help lay the foundational infrastructure for how we scale.

You’ll be stepping into a high-ownership IC role that touches every corner of the business—building the processes, systems, and workflows that will shape how we operate and support our team globally.

What You’ll Do

Within 3 months, you will:

  • Take full ownership of employee lifecycle processes including onboarding, offboarding, and transfers, with a clear eye on efficiency and accuracy.

  • Lead a vendor evaluation process and, if needed, scope out implementation of a new HRIS and payroll provider.

  • Implement a rigorous global background check process.

Within 6 months, you will:

  • Evaluate and clean up our existing HR systems for data hygiene, usability, and reporting needs.

  • Autonomously support the execution of our People Programs.

  • Finalize and roll out updated core policies and an employee handbook that reflect our growth stage, distributed setup, and compliance needs.

  • Partner with IT and Finance to implement systemic improvements across onboarding, offboarding, and access provisioning.

  • Establish repeatable onboarding/offboarding experiences that consistently hit satisfaction, completion, and compliance targets.

Within 9 months, you will:

  • Operationalize a scalable, data-driven People Ops engine with automated processes and recurring program calendars.

  • Stand up consistent reporting on People metrics (e.g., headcount changes, turnover trends, compensation bands).

  • Develop a roadmap for future state of People systems and policies to support global scale, including contingent workforce support.

What You’ll Bring

  • Systems fluency: you’ve implemented and managed an HR tech stack, and you think in data structures.

  • Strong project management and process design skills: you can create clarity in chaos and get things across the finish line on time.

  • High accountability and low ego: you own the outcomes, not just the tasks, and you don’t mind getting in the weeds when needed.

  • Builder’s mindset with operator’s discipline: you optimize for what’s needed today while building a foundation that can scale.

  • Proven track record owning People Ops in a high-growth, fast-paced startup environment, with a focus on building from 0 → 1.

  • Deep understanding of HR compliance, employment law, and policy management across multiple states in the US and Latin America.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills: you explain complex processes simply and build credibility with stakeholders.

Please note that this role may evolve as our business needs change, so we appreciate your flexibility and adaptability.

What’s In It For You?

  • Remote Flexibility: Enjoy the freedom of remote work from anywhere, balancing life and career seamlessly.

  • Unforgettable Off-Sites: Twice a year, bond with colleagues in exciting destinations, fostering teamwork and fresh ideas.

  • Paid Time Off: Enjoy flexible PTO days yearly for relaxation and rejuvenation.

  • Stock Options: Joining us means having a stake in our success, so you'll receive stock options as part of your compensation package.

  • Home Office Setup: Create your ideal workspace with a dedicated budget for home office essentials.

  • Work Trip Budget: Grow personally and professionally with a budget for work-related trips and co-working.

  • Health Coverage: Prioritize your well-being with comprehensive health and dental insurance plans.

About Us

Clutch is a revolutionary vertical SaaS company, proudly backed by Andreessen Horowitz (A16z), aimed at revolutionizing the way Credit Unions engage and change the lives of their members. As a champion of financial well-being, we address the urgent need for affordable lending solutions in an era where the average American grapples with over $155,000 in household debt.  Unlike traditional financial institutions, Clutch develops software to turn Credit Unions into FinTech lenders and leverage their balance sheets to responsibly lend to over 130M Americans. Our mission extends beyond mere financial transactions; we strive to fundamentally enhance the way credit unions interact with their members. By integrating cutting-edge technologies and user-centric designs, we help credit unions provide seamless digital experiences that are on par with leading tech companies. This approach not only preserves but revitalizes the longstanding tradition of community and member-focused service inherent to credit unions.

Clutch is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Our organization participates in E-Verify. Click here to learn about E-Verify.

A Note About AI at Clutch
We love AI. We use it often and encourage our team to creatively and effectively leverage AI tools in their work. If you join Clutch, we hope you'll bring the same enthusiasm for exploring how AI can amplify impact, productivity, and innovation.

That said, during the interview process, we want to hear your thoughts. Please approach interviews without the use of AI tools—our goal is to get to know how you think, solve problems, and communicate. Once you're in the seat, bring on the prompts!

title: Enterprise Account Executive - Saudi/UAE/Egypt
Dutch Localization Proofreader
description:
Our mission at Duolingo is to develop the best education in the world and make it universally available. But we've got more left to do — and that's where you come in!

Come join our Localization team and help us create the best possible user experience for Dutch learners through high-quality localization. We are looking for a tech-savvy, native Dutch translator/proofreader fluent in English to create the best possible user experience for Dutch learners through high-quality translation and localization.

This is a contract role that can be based anywhere in the world.

Responsibilities:

  • Localize all marketing and product copies, ensuring they are accurate, charismatic, and reflect Duolingo's style guide and requirements
  • Attend meetings/consult with fellow team members to discuss translations and align on style, tone, and vocabulary
  • Contribute to the development of in-house style guides for Dutch
  • Conduct QA on the live app to ensure that original content is not only correct and understandable for the Dutch audience, but also engaging and compelling

Requirements:

  • Native fluency in Dutch and full professional fluency in English
  • 3+ years of experience in translating, transcreation, proofreading, and/or copywriting for a Dutch audience
  • Experience localizing online, mobile, and/or game products
  • A portfolio of past work to demonstrate your expertise
  • Strong interest in Duolingo and our mission
  • Ability to work 5-15 hrs/week (workload may vary from week to week)

About Duolingo:

Duolingo is the most popular language-learning application in the world, with over 500 million users and over half a billion exercises completed daily. Beyond our core learning product, we also offer English proficiency testing with the Duolingo English Test, and are bringing new subjects into the Duolingo app, where people can develop their Math and Music skills.

We are passionate about educating our users, making fact-based decisions, and finding innovative solutions to complex problems. We offer meaningful work, limitless learning opportunities, and collaboration with world-class minds. Come brighten your life and over half a billion more!

Duolingo is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

By applying for this position your data will be processed as per the Duolingo Applicant Privacy Notice.

title: Junior AI Automation Associate
description:
Are you passionate about technology and problem-solving? Do you love playing strategy games like Civilization, Age of Empires, or Starcraft, where planning, puzzles, and logic come together to form complex strategies? Do you want to dive into the world of AI, learning how to leverage powerful tools like ChatGPT to create automation and streamline processes for a fast-growing company in the cannabis industry?

At Headquarters, we are looking for enthusiastic, curious, and driven individuals who are ready to learn and grow in the field of AI-driven automation. This role is designed for early-career candidates who are motivated by challenges and want to help various teams across the company solve real-world problems using cutting-edge AI technology.

⏰ This is a full-time (8 working hours per day) role.

It requires working 4 hours a day 8am - 12pm PST (5pm - 9pm Serbia time zone), while the other 4 hours are flexible.
*You are entitled to a one-hour break within these 8 hours.

Key Responsibilities:

✅Design, Develop, and Deploy AI Agents:

    • Develop and implement custom AI agents to automate tasks and improve operational efficiency within the organization.
    • Collaborate with internal teams to identify automation opportunities that can be leveraged through AI agents.

✅AI Integration with Business Processes:

    • Work with different departments to integrate AI solutions that optimize key business processes (such as sales, marketing, data analysis etc.).
    • Ensure that AI solutions align with specific business needs and improve existing workflows.

✅Automation of Business Workflows:

    • Create and maintain automated workflows using AI tools and automation platforms such as n8n, Zapier, Make.com, among others.
    • Develop and optimize automations for repetitive tasks, data management, and decision-making processes.

✅Develop Enterprise Prompts:

    • Create and refine enterprise-specific AI prompts to ensure they generate accurate and relevant results within the automation systems.
    • Continuously improve the quality and accuracy of prompts, adjusting them to the evolving needs of the organization.

✅Data Analysis and Reporting:

    • Monitor and analyze the performance of AI agents and automations to ensure they meet business objectives.
    • Generate reports on the efficiency of the deployed solutions and propose improvements.

✅Collaboration with Stakeholders:

    • Collaborate closely with IT, development, marketing, and other departments to identify AI and automation needs.
    • Assist teams in understanding how AI and automation can be used to solve complex problems and increase productivity.

✅Continuous Learning and Improvement:

    • Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and automation.
    • Apply new knowledge and technologies to improve existing AI solutions and explore new opportunities for the company.

Requirements

 

❌No experience necessary: You don’t need prior experience in AI or automation—just a curious mindset, a passion for learning, and the drive to solve puzzles.

✔️ Strong communicator: While you don’t need to be a native English speaker, you should be able to communicate clearly in English (both written and spoken) to collaborate with global teams.

✔️ Team player: Ability to work in a remote, collaborative environment, communicating and sharing ideas with team members from different backgrounds and cultures.

✔️ Problem-solver: Whether it’s optimizing processes or debugging an automation system, you should be able to approach challenges with persistence and creativity.

Benefits

 

📚Learn and grow: Get hands-on experience working with cutting-edge AI tools, with plenty of opportunities to expand your knowledge and skills.

📊Exciting industry: Join the cannabis industry, which is growing fast and evolving rapidly, with new challenges and opportunities arising every day.

💻Fully remote position: Work from anywhere, and be part of a remote-first, entrepreneurial team.

🚀Collaborative environment: Work alongside passionate people who are eager to make an impact and support each other’s growth.

📈Performance-based salary growth


Looking forward to meeting you!



About the company

 

 

HeadQuarters is a global start-up that partners with US cannabis companies to provide support in finance, sales operations & logistics.

title: Founding Lead AI Engineer
description:
Who We Are

We’re two commercial and operational co-founders with a proven track record in growing and scaling companies—including a $43M trade sale.  Between us, we’ve led M&A deals, built high-performing teams, and launched multiple startups. After collaborating closely for the past six months, we’ve decided to build something much bigger together. 

Now, we're assembling a world-class founding team to bring our vision to life.

We're building the next billion-dollar lean startup, and we’re looking for a forward-thinking technical founding engineer to join us. You’ll be the technical brain behind the product, owning architecture and execution while shaping the future of the business from day one.

We're now looking to bolster this great founding team with a forward-thinking technical engineer who shares our enthusiasm and brings equally excellent technical finesse. To put it bluntly: if you build something great, we’ll sell the sh!t out of it, and we'll have fun doing it! 🚀

About the Role

Join us as the Founding Lead AI Engineer, where you’ll architect and build the agentic core of our next-gen SaaS platform. This isn’t just about integrating LLMs, it’s about engineering AI-native systems from the ground up: dynamic agents, retrieval-augmented workflows, vector-based memory, and continuous learning loops.

You’ll lead the development of our foundational AI layer—working with tools like RAG pipelines, vector databases, prompt orchestration frameworks, and custom LLM integrations (built primarily on Azure). From prototype to scale, you’ll shape not just our tech stack, but how AI thinks, acts, and executes within our product.

This is a rare opportunity to:

  • Build real AI systems—not wrappers—with agency, memory, and autonomy
  • Own the technical direction of a category-defining product
  • Work alongside experienced, go-to-market obsessed founders who know how to scale
Key Responsibilities
🧠 AI Architecture & Autonomy
  • Design intelligent agent frameworks and retrieval pipelines that enable dynamic, real-world decision making.
  • Architect modular, testable AI systems that integrate seamlessly with our core backend and product layer.
  • Create flexible APIs that power decision automation and context-aware execution.
⚙️ Model Integration & ML Engineering
  • Deploy and fine-tune open or closed-source LLMs to serve dynamic, context-rich use cases.
  • Implement embedding models and search workflows to provide grounding, relevance, and long-term memory.
  • Continuously optimize model performance and pipeline speed, balancing quality and cost.
📊 Data Infrastructure & Learning Systems
  • Structure ingestion pipelines for both structured and unstructured data.
  • Build foundational components that allow our AI systems to learn from real-world signals and interactions.
  • Enable real-time, feedback-driven improvement across key AI workflows.
🤝 Collaboration & Roadmap Leadership
  • Partner closely with the commercial founders to define the AI roadmap and product priorities.
  • Work alongside full-stack engineers to integrate agentic capabilities into the end-user experience.
  • Lead with a lean, iterative mindset, automate what can be automated, and always ship value.
  • Stay sharp on LLM innovation, agentic tooling, RAG systems, and co-pilot frameworks.
Who You Are
  • ✔️ A seasoned AI/ML engineer with 2+ years of hands-on experience in deploying LLMs, RAG pipelines, and AI search technologies. (We want operators with real experience not just PHD’s)...
  • ✔️ You’ve worked with LLMs, search pipelines, or agents—and know the difference between demo and scale.
  • ✔️ You think in systems and flows, not just model performance.
  • ✔️ Experienced with vector search technologies.
  • ✔️ Deeply curious, execution obsessed, and allergic to fluff.

Requirements

  • 2+ years of hands-on experience in deploying AI/ML systems in production
  • Fluent or Native English (written and spoken) is essential.
  • Proven experience building with large language models (LLMs), retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), or vector search technologies.
  • Deep knowledge of machine learning engineering, prompt orchestration, and model optimisation.
  • Experience architecting AI workflows involving embeddings, memory, reasoning, and automation.
  • Familiarity with AI pipeline tools, versioning, and production-ready deployment practices.
  • Strong programming skills in Python and experience working with API-first backends.
  • Ability to design and integrate AI systems into broader product infrastructure.
  • Comfort working in high-ownership, low-structure startup environments.
  • Bonus: Experience with agentic frameworks, LangChain, Semantic Kernel, or co-pilot development.

Benefits

  • Excellent early-stage equity — up to 10.0%.
  • Competitive salary post-funding, aligned with market and contribution.
  • True founding role — shape the product, company, and technical culture from day one.
  • Work with proven commercial and operational operators — our founding team includes experienced founders with a $43M exit, deep GTM expertise, and a track record of scaling companies.
  • Be part of something meaningful — we’re building an AI-first SaaS company tackling real, valuable problems with real-world impact.
  • Remote-first work culture — work from anywhere in the world 🌍
  • Timezone alignment — must be available to collaborate across UTC±2 (e.g., UK, Europe, Africa).
  • Flexible hours — async-friendly, outcome-focused team.
  • Zero bureaucracy, high trust — full autonomy and ownership from the start.
  • Ground-floor opportunity — your decisions, code, and thinking will shape the product, the stack, and the company.

⚠️ Please note: this is an equity-first founding role until we raise funding. If you’re not comfortable with this structure, we totally understand—but this likely won’t be the right fit.
We’re looking for someone who sees this not just as a job, but as a chance to build something category-defining alongside a team who’ll go all-in with you.



About the company

 

🚀 At Launchyfi, we create the perfect match between your GTM and the tools that drive unstoppable growth — so you can focus on closing deals, not managing chaos.
→ Ex-SaaS founders and operators who know how to scale.
→ End-to-end GTM execution that fuels growth and revenue.
🌍 Ready to scale? Let’s go.

title: Head of Marketing
description:
Description


  • Are you passionate about devising marketing strategies that drive brand awareness and customer engagement?
  • Are you enthusiastic about spearheading marketing initiatives aimed at connecting with website creators and empowering them to achieve online success?
  • Do you excel in the ever-evolving world of tech and SaaS, leading teams to drive product adoption and revenue growth?

If you answered yes to these questions, we are sure this position will sound super exciting to you. 🤩


We are looking for a talented and experienced Head of Marketing to define the strategic plan and implement marketing initiatives that directly aligns with revenue growth for Rank Math, the popular WordPress SEO plugin.


Keep reading for more details! 📝


Become Our Head of Marketing!


If you are passionate about driving user-focused innovation, developing strategies that directly impact sales and revenue, and leading a high-performing team towards achieving ambitious growth targets, this is the perfect opportunity for you.


In your role as Head of Marketing, you will lead the Rank Math marketing team to maximize revenue growth, drive customer acquisition and retention, and enhance brand awareness.


You will oversee a team of 5 marketing experts in the fields of SEO & content, video creation and communication.


In this position, you will report directly to the VP of Marketing for the WordPress Ecosystem.


We all work remotely, and ideally you should live in a time zone between GMT+3 to GMT-5. We are so curious to know which new country will be added to our distributed team map! 🌍


What You Will Be Doing:


Here is a list describing the tasks involved in this position (do you happen to like making lists? So do we!):


  • Develop and implement a strategic marketing plan that directly aligns with and supports sales and revenue growth objectives, focusing on increasing brand awareness, driving user acquisition, and boosting customer retention
  • Design and execute high-impact, data-driven marketing campaigns across various channels, including content marketing, email marketing, and ads, with a clear focus on generating sales.
  • Optimize user onboarding experiences and customer journey to enhance user satisfaction and product adoption.
  • Manage the marketing budget effectively, ensuring a strong return on investment.
  • Lead and mentor a talented marketing team, fostering a culture of excellence, creativity and growth.
  • Collaborate with the affiliate and partnerships team to provide product insights and enhance positioning and messaging leading to more sales.
  • Continuously analyze market trends, competitor activities, the WordPress ecosystem and user feedback to inform marketing strategies.
  • Monitor and report on key performance metrics, presenting findings and recommendations.


What Do You Need To Excel at This Job:


  • Proven International Tech Marketing Expertise: Demonstrated success in marketing SaaS/tech/ecommerce products on a global scale, with a track record of achieving results.
  • SEO Expertise: Comprehensive knowledge of SEO, enabling you to effectively address the needs of our SEO expert audience and adapt our marketing strategies to boost user engagement and satisfaction.
  • Effective Communication Skills: Exceptional proficiency in written and verbal communication in English.
  • Data-Driven Decision-Making: Strong analytical skills, with the capability to gather and interpret data for informed strategic choices.
  • Inspiring Leadership: Excellent leadership and team management abilities, with the capacity to inspire, motivate, and empower teams to accomplish ambitious objectives. 
  • Innovative and Creative Thinking: A creative mindset coupled with a fervor for technology and a drive for innovation.


Do you want to know three other things we appreciate about our candidates?


  • A startup mentality 

You are a doer, you are adaptable and you like to evolve in a fast-paced environment.

  • Previous remote job experience. 

Slack will be your virtual office, where all the life of the company takes place.

  • Involvement in the WordPress community. 

We support and encourage our teammates to attend and/or speak at WordCamps and volunteer within the community.


What You Should Know About Us


Founded in 2020, Rank Math is the swiss army knife of SEO, powered by a distributed team of +27 teammates living around the world.


Rank Math is part of group.one, a leading European provider of online presence, cloud hosting and digital marketing services.


Be the “insider” and join Rank Math to be at the forefront of WordPress SEO. We are a 100% remote team that is small but passionate about SEO, developers, designers, and marketers.


We are cool and let you choose your own work hours. We don’t fuss over working hours and focus on meeting deadlines by letting you work at your own pace.


We believe the only way to grow is to do it together.


So, come and be part of our larger-than-life team! We can’t wait to have you.
